name: Espresso Frappe
description: A delicious drink that conquers at first glance: an inviting, velvety iced foam prepared on the spot. This milk-free beverage is a light, soft version of the frappe made with just espresso, a few ice cubes and a little sugar
ingredients: 1 tbsp plus 1 tsp (20 ml) liquid sugar
preparation: 1. Chill the 2/3 cup (150 ml) glass
2. Prepare two espressos in a cappuccino cup
3. Put the ice cubes, liquid sugar and two espressos, which are added as the last ingredient, into the blender. Blend for 30 seconds, until it thickens into a frappe.
4. Pour into the glass, filtering the ice with the strainer. Serve.

name: Greek Cappuccino
description: A shower of crushed ice makes this drink a lighter version of a traditional iced cappuccino.
preparation: 1. Chill an 8 oz ( 240 ml) glass
2. Prepare the espresso into a small pour pitcher
3. Place the ice cubes, liquid sugar, skim milk and espresso in a blender
4. Blend for no more than 5 seconds and pour into the glass

name: Freddo Espresso Shaken
description: This recipe is a cold and refreshing espresso drink, perfect from those warm summer days. Prepared in a shaker with sugar and a few ice cubes, the espresso acquires an irresistible soft cream. A delight to be sipped during a relaxing break.  Enjoy with a biscotti or two.
preparation: 1. Chill the glass.
2. Prepare two espressos in a cappuccino cup.
3. Put the ice cubes, liquid sugar and two espressos, which are added as the last ingredient, into the Boston shaker.
4. Shake vigorously and pour into the chilled glass, filtering the ice with a strainer.

name: Tiramisu Espresso
description: A drinkable version of a favorite Italian dessert, perfect at the end of a meal or as a rich and tasty treat.
ingredients: 1 scoop vanilla ice cream or gelato
preparation: 1. Prepare 2 shots espresso into a small pour pitcher
2. Place ice cream or gelato, ladyfingers and espresso in a blender
3. Blend 20-30 seconds until thick, with a frappé texture
4. Pour into a decorative glass and top with a dusting of cocoa powder

name: Light Melting Espresso
description: A combination of coffee and chocolate with a delicate touch of milk, giving rise to a cold, light froth with an unexpected warm espresso heart.
ingredients: 1 tbsp plus 1 or 2 tsp (20-25 ml) espresso
Approx. 1/16 oz (3 g) unsweetened cocoa powder
preparation: 1. Prepare the espresso in the cup and sweeten it with some liquid sugar.
2. Mix the milk and cocoa powder in the frothing pitcher.
3. Pour the milk and cocoa frappe into the 2/3 cup (150 ml) glass and add the sweetened espresso, pouring it into the center of the frappe. Decorate with a light dusting of cocoa powder.

name: Espresso Freddo Greco
description: It looks like the classic shaken double this cold espresso, which makes it even more intriguing. The king of classics meets ice, to give the palate an intense and vigorous pleasure.
preparation: 1. Chill an 8 oz (150 ml) glass.
2. Prepare 2 espresso into a cappuccino cup.
3. In the mixing glass, mix the ice, the liquid sugar and the 2 espresso with the mixing spoon, which you will add as the last ingredient. Blend for up to 5 seconds.
4. Pour the mixture into the glass and serve.

name: Espresso Freddo
description: A cold variation of excellence of the most classic coffee, espresso.
ingredients: 2 tsp (10 ml) of cold mineral water
preparation: 1. Chill an 8 oz (240 ml) glass.
2. Prepare 2 espresso into a cappuccino cup.
3. In the mixing glass, mix the water, ice cubes, liquid sugar and the 2 espresso with the mixing spoon, which you will add as the last ingredient.
4. Pour the mixture into the glass, filtering the ice with the strainer, and serve.

name: Affogato
description: The affogato immediately spreads good cheer. This delectable espresso dessert features ice cream and a rich, smooth covering of espresso.
ingredients: 1 tbsp. plus 1 or 2 tsp (20-25 ml) espresso
preparation: 1. Prepare the espresso in a small cup.
2. Put the  ice cream in the glass and pour the espresso over it.
3. Add whip cream (optional) and use as garnish.
4. Decorate with a little cocoa powder and serve.

name: Amore
description: An encounter between a double espresso and the sweet personality of amaretto liqueur, including a dense layer of shaken cream. It is no coincidence that this hot, intense, aromatic drink, with a romantic soul, is called Amore.
preparation: 1. Prepare two espresso in a cappuccino cup.
2. Pour the liqueur into the glass and heat it with your espresso machine’s steam wand. Take care to not overheat it, as this would change its aromas.
3. Add the espresso to the liqueur.
4. Pour the cream, which should be very cold, into the mini shaker. Shake until the mixture becomes quite dense.
5. Gently rest the cream on the surface of the cocktail, making it run down the back of the mixing spoon so that it stays on the surface.
6. Garnish with two coffee beans and a dusting of cane sugar, and serve.

name: Irish Coffee
description: A classic born in Ireland and celebrated all over the world for its combination of coffee and Irish whiskey. A delicate layer of thick but not overly-whipped cream tempers the strength of this cocktail, and completes its perfection.
ingredients: Approx. 3 tbsp (40 ml) fresh heavy cream
preparation: 1. Prepare two espresso into a cappuccino cup.
2. Pour the whiskey and the cane sugar into a serving glass, heating it with the steam wand of your espresso machine. Take care not to overheat it as this will alter the taste of the whiskey.
3. Add the coffee to the glass of warmed whiskey.
4. Shake the cream, which should be very cold, in the mini shaker until it becomes quite thick.
5. Layer the cream on the cocktail, gently pouring it over the back of a mixing spoon so that it floats on top of the coffee.
6. Decorate with a dusting of cocoa powder and garnish with two coffee beans before serving.

name: Vodka Espresso
description: Vodka in this cold cocktail meets espresso: the two discover they like each other a lot and together they willingly abandon themselves to the creaminess of the coffee liqueur, creating a perfect harmony of flavors.
preparation: 1. Prepare the espresso in the cup.
2. Add the liquid sugar, coffee liqueur, white vodka and, finally, the espresso. Cool by mixing the ingredients with the mixing spoon.
3. Pour the mixture into the glass together with some ice cubes and serve.

name: Espresso Delight
description: With its pure white decadence, the shaken cream hides under a delectable layer of chocolate and coffee, to which a touch of alcohol adds a cheeky touch. The unmistakeable taste of espresso is enhanced by the aromatic notes of liqueur that accompanies it.
ingredients: 1 TBSP plus 2 TSP (25 ml) of espresso
1 TBSP plus 1 TSP (20 ml) of coffee liqueur
Approx. 3 TBSP (40 ml) of heavy cream
preparation: 1. Prepare the espresso in a small cup.
2. Prepare the hot chocolate in the pitcher.  Sweeten it with some liquid sugar to taste.
3. Pour the hot chocolate, espresso, and liqueur into a glass
4. Shake the cream in a shaker, which should be very cold, until it becomes quite thick.
5. Gently rest the cream on the surface of the cocktail, making it run down the back of the mixing spoon, and serve.

name: Americano
description: Even the Italian espresso can be tempted by the American dream. When a bigger cup of coffee is in order, espresso teams up with boiling water, transforming into a drink to be enjoyed over time, and sipped at any time of day.
preparation: 1. Prepare the espresso in a small cup
2. Fill a cappuccino cup with hot water (about 190 F, or 90 C) and add as much of the espresso as you prefer. Serve

name: Double Espresso
preparation: Prepare two espresso in a cappuccino cup and serve.

name: Espresso Lungo
description: When it is slightly lengthened, espresso is a pleasure to be enjoyed slowly. Strong and passionate like a story, this coffee has a special way of unfolding in the cup, with an abundance of unique qualities.
ingredients: 1/4 oz (7 g) ground espresso coffee, pod or capsule
preparation: 1. You can follow the classic method, using your espresso machine as usual with a capsule, pod or ground coffee. You will have to make sure however, to extend the extraction to 35 seconds: this way, you will have about 30 ml (2 tbsp) of coffee in the cup.
2. Alternatively, first prepare a classic espresso; then, right in the espresso cup, add however much hot water you prefer using the pitcher.

name: Mugaccino
description: Less is more doesn’t apply to the Mugaccino, a maxi-version of the caffelatte that likes to think big. Served in a coffee mug, this is a double espresso with as much foam as you like for a full cup of satisfaction.
preparation: 1. Prepare two espresso into a cup or pour pitcher and then add to a coffee mug.
2. Froth the milk in a steaming pitcher, using the steam wand of your espresso machine.
3. Finish by pouring the frothed milk on top of the double espresso and serve.

name: Latte
description: A coffeehouse favorite that blends deliciously with flavored syrups.
preparation: 1. Prepare 2 shots of espresso into a small cup or pour pitcher
2. Pour into a serving glass
3. Steam and froth the milk in a steaming pitcher, taking care not to let it foam too much as it needs to stay on the liquid side
4. Pour the milk over coffee, holding back froth until glass is filled 1 inch (2.5 cm) from the top
5. Top with a thin layer of froth

name: Latte Macchiato
description: A warm embrace between soft, foamy milk and the richness of espresso.
ingredients: 1/3 cup plus 2 tsp whole milk (90 ml)
preparation: 1. Prepare the espresso in a small cup or pour pitcher
2. Foam the milk in a steaming pitcher, and pour it into a decorative glass
3. Add the espresso to the glass

name: Macchiato
description: This espresso gives into a delicate indulgence, making it the perfect choice to finish off a pleasant break or start out the day with an extra edge. The velvety foam is a short, exquisite prelude to the intense flavor of the coffee - the right balance between the power of espresso and the delicacy of milk.
ingredients: 1 tbsp plus 1 or 2 tsp (20-25 ml) espresso
Approx. 2 tbsp (28 ml) fresh whole milk
preparation: 1. Prepare the espresso in a small cup.
2. Foam the milk in the pitcher, using your espresso machines steam wand.
3. Pour the foam onto the espresso, filling the cup almost to the brim.

name: Cappuccino Viennese
description: A traditional coffeehouse favorite marked by its generous whipped cream topping.
preparation: 1. Prepare espresso directly into a cappuccino cup
2. Steam and froth the milk in a steaming pitcher using the steam wand of your espresso machine.
3. Pour milk directly over coffee until it is about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm) from the top.
4. Whip the heavy cream in a small bowl or mixing cup until it is thick.
5. Top the coffee with whipped cream and dust lightly with cocoa powder.

name: Chocolate Wave
description: An unusual contrast of temperatures in a delectable trio: coffee and chocolate make a show of their passion, while milk lends a cool foamy freshness as it crowns a warm, aromatic brew.
ingredients: 1 tbsp plus 1 tsp skim milk (20 ml)
preparation: Prepare the hot chocolate in the pitcher and pour it into the glass.
Prepare the Espresso directly into the same glass, adding it to the hot chocolate.
Foam the cold milk in the pitcher with the milk frother.
To finish, add the foam to the coffee and chocolate and serve.

name: Melting Snow
description: Together again, coffee, milk and cocoa enjoy themselves with new variations on the theme: here they create a hot, intense drink, sweetened by a touch of aromatic cane sugar and cooled with soft milk snow. The surprise this drink has up its sleeve is its unusual contrast between hot and cold.
ingredients: 1 tbsp. plus 1 or 2 tsp (20-25 ml) espresso
approx 1/16 oz (3 g) unsweetened cocoa powder, plus some for dusting
preparation: 1. Prepare the Espresso in a small cup.
2. In the frothing pitcher, combine the liquid sugar, whole milk and approx 1/16 oz (3 g) of cocoa powder; heat it with your espresso machine's steam wand, being sure to keep it on the surface.
3. Add the espresso to the heated mixture and combine, moving the frothing pitcher with a circular movement. Pour into the glass.
4. Foam the skim milk in the frothing pitcher using the milk frother and add it to the mixture in the glass.
5. Decorate with a light dusting of cocoa powder, and serve.

name: Marocchino
description: The Hot Marocchino is an inspired composition of deep colors, creamy consistencies and intense flavors. Serve it in a glass to reveal the full mouthwatering beauty of this specialty drink—chocolate on the bottom, coffee and milk in the middle and a velvety cream on top-an experience to enjoy layer by delicious layer.
ingredients: 1 scant oz (25 ml) fresh whole milk
preparation: 1. Prepare the hot chocolate in a small pitcher and pour it into the serving glass.
2. Prepare the espresso directly into the same glass, adding it to the hot chocolate.
3. Dust the mixture with a fine layer of cocoa powder.
4. Foam the milk in a steaming pitcher, using the steam wand of your espresso machine.
5. Gently pour the foam on top of the coffee/hot chocolate mixture and serve.
